intro: Heliophila magaliesbergensis, commonly known as the Magaliesberg heliophyte, is a flowering plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the Apiaceae family, which includes carrots and parsley, and is characterized by its slender, branched stems and small, greenish-white flowers. The plant typically grows in moist, sandy soils and is often found in grassland habitats. It is adapted to temperate climates and is known for its ability to thrive in well-drained environments. Heliophila magaliesbergensis plays a role in supporting local pollinators and contributes to the biodiversity of its native ecosystems.
